page.title: 09DAIRY FARMING
page.content: Hayecasle Farm has 250 cattle altogether,80 milking cows and 170 beef cattle.The milkers are Friesians, the rest are Charolais and Limousin. The 30 calves are a mixture.The farmer gets 320 gallons of milk a day;his best cow yields 7 gallons a day.After about 8 years the cows are sold or sooner if their milk dries up. The cows are milked twice a day,once at 6am and again at 4pm.They are given cow cake while they are milked.The milk is sent to the Milk Marketing Board to be bottled. 22 acres of barley is grown,mostly to feed to the animals.There are two working sheep dogs and a puppy on the farm,4 ponies and a Clydesdale Shire horse.Mr Christopherson made us very welcome at his farm and we learnt alot.
